column4: i can't install ubuntu (any version), cdrom fails to be mounted durning instalation, what to do? i tried changing in BIOS from AHCI to IDE or IDE/RAID but that doesnt help! pci=noacpi and acpi=off doesnt do anything either. please help me someone

i can't install ubuntu (any version), cdrom fails to be mounted durning instalation, what to do? i tried changing in BIOS from AHCI to IDE or IDE/RAID but that doesnt help! pci=noacpi and acpi=off doesnt do anything neither. I tried different CD and CD-ROMs. please help me someone.
can you install anything?
like, for example, knoppix?
microsoft does NOT have a microkernel
unless something changed recently...?
yes, i can install anything, like debian, but not ubuntu
I hate Gigabyte stuff. =P
get a nice FIC motherboard
i just bought it and it's nice ;)
XBitlabs reviewed it high, and i personally think it's good motherboard. quite cheap for what i get
I have no loyalty. =P
besides, Ubuntu is based on Debian, uses many of the same programs as Debian does, etc. Debian is well-established as a high-quality OS.
it's a real shame that it won't Just Work(tm), and unforunately I have no experience relevant to how you might get things working. I hope somebody answers your forum post.
evidently, few people understand the problem
you need to find or submit a relevant bugzilla entry, not rely on the unofficial forums
if you find an old bugzilla entry, try to get the train moving again by sending out a few emails
ok, i will try that
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/grub/+bug/64574
have you tried using LILO?
might that possibly help anything?
